Extra Cards.description: When used, copies the effect of the most recently usedPill,Card, Rune, Soul Stone, oractivated item.

Transformations.name: Guppy
Transformations.description: Isaac turns into his cat Guppy and gains the ability to fly. Every time you successfully hit with a tear, a blue fly will spawn (In Repentance this was nerfed to 50% of tears that hit). Taking any three of the following items will trigger the Guppy transformation.

Transformations.name: Beelzebub
Transformations.description: Isaac turns into a human fly and gains the ability to fly. This transformation will turn most types of flies into friendly blue attack flies. Taking any three of the following items will trigger the Lord of the Flies transformation.

Transformations.name: Mom
Transformations.description: Isaac turns into his mother, giving him a knife which is attached to his butt and cannot be fired. Taking any three items in this list will give Isaac the Mom transformation.

Transformations.name: Leviathan
Transformations.description: Isaac turns into a tentacled monster, gaining 2 black hearts and the ability to fly. Taking any three items in this list will give Isaac the Leviathan transformation.

Transformations.name: Seraphim
Transformations.description: Isaac turns into a faceless angel, gaining 3 soul hearts and permanent flight. Taking any three items in this list will give Isaac the Seraphim transformation.

Transformations.name: Bob
Transformations.description: Isaac turns into Bob (Sloth) and will now leave a trail of green poisonous creep as he walks. Taking any three items in this list will give Isaac the Bob transformation.

Transformations.name: Fun Guy
Transformations.description: Isaac turns into a living Mushroom and gains +1 HP. Taking any three items in this list will give Isaac the Mushroom transformation.

Transformations.name: Conjoined
Transformations.description: Isaac grows two tumors on his face, which will fire diagonally in addition to Isaac's normal tears. This transformation is also a -0.3 damage down and -0.3 tears down.Taking any three items in this list will give Isaac the Conjoined transformation.

Transformations.name: Spun
Transformations.description: Isaac turns into a buff berserker gaining +2 Damage, +0.15 Speed and spawns a random pill on the floor. Taking any three items in this list will give Isaac the Drugs transformation.

Transformations.name: Oh Crap
Transformations.description: Isaac turns into a giant walking turd and he can now heal half a red heart each time a pile of poop is destroyed. Taking any three items in this list will give Isaac the Poop transformation.

Transformations.name: Super Bum
Transformations.description: Picking up all 3 bum familiars will combine them and transform into SUPER BUM. Super Bum will pick up any of the other bum's pickups and drop double rewards. The three items required are:

Eden.Starting Pickup(s): x0-2 bombsx0-1 keysx0-5 coinsx0-1 trinket, pill, or card

Keeper.Starting Pickup(s): x1 bombs, x1 coins, Store Key

Rooms.descripcion: Closets are rare, small, dead end Normal Rooms. They will often contain a unique arrangement of items, objects, or pickups.

Boss Rooms contain one of the manyBosses, with victory granting Isaac an item from theBoss pool,hearts(depending on difficulty), and a trap door leading to the next level. It always spawns in the room that's as far from the starting room as possible. Mini-Boss Rooms are identical in appearance to normal Rooms and contain one of theSeven Deadly Sins.

A Treasure Room, or Item Room, is guaranteed to appear on all floors fromBasement1 toDepths2. From Basement 2 and on, this Room requires akeyto enter. The Room contains one item from theTreasure Room item pool. Variousobstaclesmay be present, and occasionallyFliesorGreed Gapers/Bulbswill be present. This Room has a small chance to contain two items from the treasure pool that can both be collected, and averysmall chance of containing no item pedestal at all, instead containing one poop pile, 3Attack Flies, and variouspickups, including onetrinket. OnDownpour/Dross,Mines/Ashpit, andMausoleum/Gehenna, Treasure Rooms will always contain at least two items, with one of them being hidden, similar toCurse of the Blind. Golden Treasure Rooms always require one key to open inGreed Mode. Golden Treasure Rooms can generate in theWomb/Uteroif theBloody Crowntrinket is equipped when the floor is generated. Golden Treasure Rooms can generate inSheolwith theWicked Crowntrinket equipped, and can generate in theCathedralwith theHoly Crowntrinket equipped.  Silver Treasure Rooms are Rooms found inGreed Mode. They always contain one item from theGreed Boss Item Pool, and require no keys to open, being open from the start of the floor. Appears inGreedier Modeas well, acting exactly the same way. When carrying theDevil's Crowntrinket, any newly found or not walked into Treasure Room becomes a Red Treasure Room, which contain items from the Devil Room pool for the price of heart containers. The prices are the same as normally required in regularDevil Deals.

Planetariums are similar to Treasure Rooms, but only contain one powerful celestial item belonging to thePlanetarium (Item Pool), items exclusive to Planetarium Rooms. Planetariums have an additive and higher chance of spawning if the player avoids walking into Treasure Rooms.

Shops require a key to open. They sell various items and pickups in exchange for coins. Shops start at level 0 and only sell 2 things, but Shops at higher levels sell more things. They can be upgraded through theDonation Machine, which can be commonly found in the Shops and sometimes in anArcade.Shops also have a chance of being replaced by a miniboss Room containingGreedorSuper Greed. Shops can generate in theWomb/Uteroif theSilver Dollartrinket is equipped when the floor is generated. The Shop spawned on the first floor is free to enter. Shops can generate inSheolwith theWicked Crowntrinket equipped, and can generate in theCathedralwith theHoly Crowntrinket equipped. Has a new Door, no longer sharing a Door with Libraries.

These Rooms are locked and require one coin to be opened. Arcades can only spawn on even floors (Basement II, Caves II, Depths II, Womb II, etc) if the previous floor was completed with 5 or more coins.Arcadescan containmachines,beggars, and other objects. Arcades will spawn on the first floor of the alternate chapters (DownpourI,MinesI,MausoleumI,CorpseI).

Challenge Rooms will only generate if Isaac has full health upon entering the first floor of aChapter. Challenge Rooms can only be entered if Isaac's total health (red, black, and soul hearts) is equal to or greater than his number of heart containers. Upon picking up its contents, Isaac has to fight three waves of enemies.  Boss Challenge Rooms will only generate if Isaac has full health upon entering the second floor of aChapter. They also can only be entered if Isaac has one or less red heart. Its contents are similar to the Normal Challenge Room, but upon picking up its contents, Isaac has to fight two waves ofBossesinstead of normal monsters. Boss Challenge Rooms now can only be entered normally if Isaac's total health (red, black, and soul hearts) is equal to or less than 1 full heart, but now always contain an item fromthe Boss Item Pool.

Curse Rooms are special rooms with spikes on the door that hurt Isaac when entering and exiting the Room. Curse Rooms can contain various things, ranging from enemies, red chests, to even pedestalitemsfrom theCurse Room Item Pool. However, Isaac doesn't take damage upon entering the room if he hasflight(still takes damage upon exiting).

Sacrifice Rooms are special rooms that have a chance to spawn aChestor other preset rewards after Isaac damages himself on the spikes featured at the center of the Room. Sacrifice Rooms have a higher chance to spawn if Isaac has more health to sacrifice (if Isaac's total health (red, black, and soul hearts) is equal to or greater than his number of heart containers). Sacrifice Rooms now can pay with a much wider variety of rewards. Has a new bloody door, replacing its old, generic one.
Secret Rooms must be bombed into, and are usually surrounded by 3 or 4 Rooms. Secret Rooms usually containShopkeepersand variouspickups.
Super Secret Rooms must be bombed into, and are only located next to one other non-special Room. They tend to spawn closer to the Boss Room. Super Secret Rooms can contain a variety ofpickups.

Ultra Secret Rooms are very secret rooms, found when venturing one Red Room outside the normal map using theRed Key,Crystal Key,Cracked Key,Soul of Cain, or by teleporting to it withXVIII - The Moon?. These map-expanding items allow you to create Red Rooms, and if correctly found, one of those new Red Rooms will have a Secret Room passageway to the Ultra Secret Room already opened. The Ultra Secret Room itself containsKeys,key blocks, and/orShopkeepers, and one item from theUltra Secret Room item poolfor its pedestal rewards.
Libraries require a key to be entered and can containbook items,cards,runes, andtrinkets. Has a new Door, no longer sharing a door with Shops.

These Rooms allow the player to make deals with theDevilby tradinghealthforitems. Devil Rooms can also containRed Chests,Black Hearts,spikes, ormonstersalong with its signature devil statue. They may also haveFire PlacesorRed Fire Placeswhich have a chance to dropCoins,Red Hearts, and more when extinguished. Devil Roomshave a chance to containKrampusrather than any items, if Krampus is unlocked.

Angel Rooms contain an angel statue and one or moreitemsto choose from,Soul Hearts, orEternal Hearts. The Angel Room has a chance to replace the Devil Room if certain conditions are met. They may also haveBlue Fire PlacesorPurple Fire Places, which have a chance to dropSoul Heartswhen extinguished. Can now have aConfessionalin them.
Vaults require two keys to open and can contain various things, ranging fromitemstoDonation Machines.
Dice Rooms require two keys to open. Depending on the number of pips imprinted on the face of the large red die embedded in the floor, stepping onto the center of the die activates aneffect.

Bedrooms require two bombs to open. Bedrooms contain a bed that can be used once to restore all of the player's health, or if they have no red hearts, they give you 3 soul heartsand add one charge to their active item. Depending on if the Bedroom is Clean or Dirty (the main difference being the state of the bed and wall color), bombing the center of the carpet will reveal acrawl space(Clean) or a trapdoor (Dirty) leading to the next floor.

These Rooms are entered through Trapdoors with ladders in them. They can rarely be found under destroyed rocks. They can also be found usingWe Need To Go Deeper!,Rune of Ehwaz, or under aClean Bedroom'srug. These Rooms are viewed from the side, rather than the top like the rest of the Rooms in the game. Crawl Spaces usually contain an item or variouspickups. Rarely, the Crawl Space will lead to aBlack Market. Black markets are accessed through Rare Crawl Spaces. These Rooms are 2 Rooms wide and haveshop itemsthat can all be bought for 1 heart container, likedevil deals. Black Markets also have a trapdoor to the next floor and variousmachinesorbeggars.

Angel Room Shops are special holy shops, accessed if Isaac hasThe Stairway. The Stairway will spawn a ladder in the starting room of each floor that leads to each floor's Angel Room shop, aShopthat sellsAngel deal items, has angel-related pickups, sometimes includes a coinbeggaror aConfessional, and always includes an angel statue. This ladder disappears upon leaving the room.

Secret shops are accessed by buying aMember Card, opening up a 'special' Shop Trapdoor that leads to the floor's underground shop. Secret shops have a wider variety of items and pickups, sold at various expensive prices.

Red Rooms are special rooms created when using theRed Key(and Red Key wisps spawned withBook of Virtues),Crystal Key,Cracked Key, or theSoul of Cain. The Red Key Rooms don't open without these items, and are spawned into existence at the closest red outline door when the item is used. The new Red Room can be a normal Room on this floor, or any special Room, aside from extra Ultra Secret Rooms and Boss Rooms. Red Rooms can't spawn where there aren't 4 connections out of the Room, not spawning if a touching room contains a bottomless pit on one wall, already is a secret room, or is a thin closet/hallway room. While inside a Red Room, the music of the floor will be slightly distorted. Red rooms can only be spawned in an 13x13 radius from the the center room of the map, or six rooms from the center room in any direction; any farther will lead to entering an I AM ERROR Room.

I AM ERROR Rooms have a small chance of being reached upon usingTelepills, and can be reached with other items such asUndefinedandRed Key. Every I AM ERROR Room contains a trapdoor to the next floor along with variouspickupsoritems. The only way out of an I AM ERROR Room is through the trapdoor or by teleporting out. UsingTeleport 2.0when all other rooms have been explored guarantees to be teleported in an I AM ERROR room. The I AM ERROR Room is a running gag within games that is a reference to the I AM ERROR easter egg in Zelda II: The Adventure of Link (1987)

If the player manages to beatMomin under 20 minutes from the start of the run (visually indicated by the clock icon that appears during the cutscene between floors), a crack will open in the wall of the Boss Room upon defeating her, allowing entry to a large Room with 2 or 4 item pedestals in the center or the corners, often blocked byrocksorspikes. Taking one of the presented items will destroy the others and begin the Boss Rush.

This long Room is only found in the starting Room ofChestandDark Room. Opening this door requires an item such asDad's Keyor the two key pieces fromAngels. Once the Room is entered, Isaac will have to face off againstMega Satan.

If the player manages to beatMom's HeartorIt Livesin under 30 minutes (visually indicated by the clock icon that appears during the cutscene between floors), a crack will open in the wall of the Boss Room upon defeating it, containing a room with a Trapdoor to???.
Mother's arena is accessible by a large pit in the ground in the Boss Room ofCorpseII. Dropping down into the pit leads to Mother's unique transforming boss room.

Exit Rooms are Rooms with the defining feature of having a Trapdoor/exit to the next Floor. Greed Exit Rooms start metal barred and unbombable, like miniboss rooms, but will be unbarred and accessible once ten waves of enemies are defeated. Exit Rooms may contain pickups, chests, and enemies. Greedier Exit Rooms are almost exactly the same as the Greed Mode Exit Room, except they take 11 rounds to open.

When unlocked, these Rooms appear attached to a Main Path Boss Room once theBossis defeated (or appear at the end of Alternate PathChapter). These Rooms contain an entrance to the Alternate Path Floors. These Rooms have different requirements to open them, based on theChapterthey are barring entrance to:  When unlocked, this room appears above the starting room of the second floor of Chapter 3, containing a trapdoor leading to a special version of the second floor of Chapter 3.5. This door can only be opened by obtaining and sacrificing eitherThe Polaroid,The Negative, orFaded Polaroid.

When unlocked, this room appears above the starting room of the second floor of Chapter 3, containing a trapdoor leading to a special version of the second floor of Chapter 3.5. This door can only be opened by obtaining and sacrificing either The Polaroid, The Negative, or (except in Rebirth)Faded Polaroid
Grave Rooms are Rooms that appear in theDark Roomwhich only contain 1-3Dirt Patches.The Forgottenis unlocked by reaching this room and digging withMom's Shovel.

The Mirror Room is a single special room found on the second floor of Chapter 1.5, containing a single mirror on either the left or right doorway location. This mirror can be broken by explosions, but also can be entered to explore theMirrored World, a replica of the current floor, to findKnife Piece 1. The mirror can only be entered byThe Lost,Tainted Lost,Tainted Forgotten, andTainted Jacob's ghost form. All other characters must touch the white fire which always generates on the second floor of Chapter 1.5 in order to temporarily become The Lost if they want to enter the mirror.

The Mine Cart Room is a single special room found on the second floor of Chapter 2.5 only if Isaac already hasKnife Piece 1. It contains a Yellow Button, a single minecart, a blocked door at the top of the room and occasionally some enemies. There are 2 other Yellow Buttons located randomly on the same floor and pressing all 3 repairs the minecart's track allowing access through the blocked door. Alternatively havingFlightand 2 bombs also allows access through the door. The area past the blocked door containsKnife Piece 2and a chase sequence withMother's Shadow. The door is permanently blocked after leaving the sub-area.

Hearts.Name: Red Heart
Hearts.Additional Info: Heals  with Maggy's Bow.Humbleing Bundle and Equality! can replace this with a Double Heart.

Hearts.Name: Soul Heart
Hearts.Additional Info: Soul Hearts are blue hearts that are added to the end of the health bar. Soul Hearts are not permanent; once lost, they cannot be replenished, although new ones may be picked up. Soul Hearts will be depleted before Red Hearts in most cases. However, donating to a Blood Donation Machine or a Devil Beggar will deplete Red Hearts first  as long as Isaac has more than half a Red Heart (a full heart in Womb and beyond).  Blood Donation Machines and Devil Beggars will now deplete Isaac's last half or full Red Heart before depleting Soul Hearts.

Hearts.Name: Eternal Heart
Hearts.Additional Info: When held until the next floor, Eternal Hearts will grant Isaac a Red Heart container. They will also give a Red Heart container if two are collected on the same floor. Characters that cannot gain Red Heart containers will instead be given a Soul Heart ( Black Heart in the case of  Dark Judas and  Tainted Judas). Eternal Hearts are placed in the second half of the last Red Heart container or Bone Heart, even when it is full (the Eternal Heart will overlap with the Red Heart in this case). If Isaac has no Red Heart containers or Bone Hearts, they are placed in the second half of his first Soul Heart or Black Heart.

Hearts.Name: Double Heart
Hearts.Additional Info: Doesn't appear naturally. Can only be found by using certain items or encountering certain rooms. Has a ~4.21% spawn rate in Normal Mode and ~1.69% in Hard Mode.Heals  with Maggy's Bow.

Hearts.Name: Black Heart
Hearts.Additional Info: When depleted, invokes The Necronomicon effect, dealing 40 damage to every vulnerable enemy in the room.  If Isaac holds A Missing Page, or has the Missing Page 2, the damage dealt will be doubled to 80. If Isaac obtains both, the damage will be tripled to 120. Acts like a Soul Heart otherwise.

Hearts.Name: Gold Heart
Hearts.Additional Info: Gold Hearts do not actually add more health, instead forming an outline around the last heart in Isaac's health bar. When that heart is depleted, the Gold Heart will break and 3-8 Coins will be dropped around Isaac. Gold Hearts flash when depleted and will temporarily turn enemies golden like Midas' Touch.

Hearts.Name: Half Soul Heart
Hearts.Additional Info: Can replace regular Soul Heart drops. Like whole Soul Hearts, they can be used to refill a half Black Heart.

Hearts.Name: Scared Heart
Hearts.Additional Info: Identical to the standard Red Heart, but pulses faster. It will run away as Isaac, Dark Bum, or Super Bum moves towards it.Heals  with Maggy's Bow.Humbleing Bundle and Equality! will not double this.
Hearts.Unlock Method: Reset 7 times in a row Switch PS4 Get a minus 10-win streak

Hearts.Name: Blended Heart
Hearts.Additional Info: Fills up a full Red Heart container, but will act as a Soul Heart when no containers are free. If Isaac is only missing half a Red Heart, it will fill that half, and give him half a Soul Heart as well.Dark Bum and The Jar will not collect this.Heals  or  with Maggy's Bow.

Hearts.Name: Bone Heart
Hearts.Additional Info: Takes three hits to deplete and can be refilled with Red Hearts ( and Rotten Hearts), but disappears permanently upon depleting.Cannot be filled as  ???,   Tainted???,  Dark Judas,  Tainted Judas,  Tainted Forgotten, or  Tainted Bethany and only protects against one hit as these characters.

Hearts.Name: Rotten Heart
Hearts.Additional Info: Rotten Hearts fill up one whole heart container, or the rightmost Red Heart if all of Isaac's heart containers are full, but can only take a half heart of damage each before being depleted (so, for example, two Rotten Hearts will be depleted if a full heart of damage is taken). Each Rotten Heart in Isaac's life bar spawns two Blue Flies upon clearing a room.
Hearts.Unlock Method: Enter Corpse for the first time

Coins.Name: Penny
Coins.Additional Info: Humbleing Bundle and Equality! can replace this with a Double Penny.

Coins.Name: Double Penny
Coins.Additional Info: Doesn't spawn naturally. Can only be found by using certain items or encountering certain rooms.

Coins.Name: Lucky Penny
Coins.Additional Info: Increases luck by 1 when picked up.Humbleing Bundle and Equality! will not double this.Bumbo and Bum Friend will pick this up, but will not give Isaac any luck.
Coins.Unlock Method: Donate 2 Coins to the Greed Donation Machine

Coins.Name: Sticky Nickel
Coins.Additional Info: Will flip upside-down when Isaac tries to collect it. Afterwards, it will get stuck on the ground, unable to be picked up unless blasted off the ground with an explosion.Bumbo and Bum Friend are unable to pick this up; they instead hover over them, attempting to pick them up. A Level 4 Bumbo will drop bombs in an attempt to pick it up.
Coins.Unlock Method: Complete the Boss Rush as  Keeper

Coins.Name: Golden Penny
Coins.Additional Info: Spawns another golden penny in a random spot in the same room after being picked up, but has a 10% chance of disappearing instead.
Coins.Unlock Method: Defeat Mega Satan as  Tainted Keeper

Bombs.Name: Bomb
Bombs.Additional Info: BOGO Bombs, Humbleing Bundle, and Equality! can replace this with a Double Bomb.

Bombs.Name: Troll Bomb
Bombs.Additional Info: Cannot be picked up. Spawns already ignited and will explode after a few seconds.Safety Scissors will turn this into a Bomb before it explodes.

Bombs.Name: Golden Bomb
Bombs.Additional Info: Will not add to the player's bomb count, but when picked up, it will allow the player to place bombs without subtracting from their total for the duration of the current floor, even if the current number of bombs is 0. Bomb Bums ignore the Golden bomb and still subtract bombs from the bomb count.

Bombs.Name: Mega Troll Bomb
Bombs.Additional Info: Like Troll Bombs, but are bigger (like bombs upgraded with Mr. Mega) and will chase Isaac if they are nearby (as if under the influence of Magneto).Safety Scissors will turn this into a Double Bomb before it explodes.

Bombs.Name: Golden Troll Bomb
Bombs.Additional Info: Like troll bombs, but are able explode endlessly, mimicking the effect of a golden bomb pickup.Safety Scissors will turn this into a Golden Bomb before it explodes.

Bombs.Name: Giga Bomb
Bombs.Additional Info: Thrown by  Bombgaggers,  Ultra War, and are spawned naturally in some rooms in Ashpit as well as one Super Secret Room layout. Explodes and destroys tiles in a diamond shape. Giga bombs deal 300 damage to enemies.Can be obtained by the player with Safety Scissors or Everything Jar.

Bombs.Name: Throwable Bomb
Bombs.Additional Info: Can only be picked up and thrown, explodes a few seconds after pickup. Spawned only by the  Bomb Grimace enemy.

Poops.Name: Poop Nugget
Poops.Additional Info: Drops from  Tainted??? when dealing damage to enemies.

Poops.Name: Big Poop Nugget
Poops.Additional Info: Any bomb pickups that would normally spawn are replaced with this when playing as  Tainted???; this does not affect  Troll Bombs and their variants.

Keys.Name: Key
Keys.Additional Info: Humbleing Bundle and Equality! can replace this with a Key Ring.

Keys.Name: Golden Key
Keys.Additional Info: Will not add to the player's key count, but when picked up, it will allow the player to use keys on anything that requires them without subtracting from their total for the duration of the current floor, even if the current number of keys is 0.Sharp Key and Key Masters ignore the Golden Key and still subtract keys from the key count.

Keys.Name: Key Ring
Keys.Additional Info: Doesn't spawn naturally. Can only be found by using certain items or encountering certain rooms.

Keys.Name: Charged Key
Keys.Additional Info: Acts as a  Lil' Battery when picked up. Key Bum will pick this up, but will not give Isaac any active charge. Key Bum will drop a  Lil' Battery when picking the key up.

Batteries.Name: Lil' Battery
Batteries.Notes: If Isaac has The Battery with no overcharge, only the main charge bar is filled. If the main bar is full, the overcharge is filled.

Batteries.Name: Mega Battery
Batteries.Notes: Overcharges Isaac's active item up to two full charges as if The Battery was held. If Isaac has multiple active items, it will charge all of them twice.

Batteries.Name: Golden Battery
Batteries.Notes: Deals a full heart of damage when picked up. Another golden battery will spawn in a random room, but it is not shown on the map until discovered.
Batteries.Unlock Method: Defeat Mega Satan as  Tainted Forgotten

Pills.Effect: Isaac farts, dealing 5 damage and poisoning enemies around him.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: The poison affects all enemies in the room.

Pills.Effect: Deals a full heart of damage to Isaac. Using a Bad Trip pill while Isaac only has a single heart left or less turns it into a Full Health pill. This doesn't count as damage for the purposes of Devil Room/Angel Room generation odds or score reduction.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: Deals two hearts of damage. If Isaac would not survive, the pill becomes Full Health.

Pills.Effect: Grants Isaac two soul hearts.
Swaps the values of Isaac's  Bombs and  Keys.The effects of  Golden Bombs and  Golden Keys are also swapped.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: The number of bombs and keys is increased by 50% while swapping.

Pills.Effect: Spawns a lit bomb behind Isaac every second for five seconds.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: Spawns more bombs with the effects of Mr. Mega and Bobby-Bomb.

Pills.Effect: Refills every empty red heart container.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: Fully heals and grants 3 soul hearts.

Pills.Effect: Removes one red heart container. Acts as a Health Up pill if Isaac has one or fewer red heart containers. Characters who cannot have red heart containers will lose one heart.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: Removes two heart containers. if Isaac has 0 or 1 heart containers, the pill becomes Health Up and if he has 2 with no other types of health, they are removed and he is given half a soul heart.

Pills.Effect: Adds one empty red heart container.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: Adds two empty red heart containers.

Pills.Effect: Changes the appearance of Isaac's face. This pill is cosmetic only, and the effect disappears when Isaac leaves the room.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: Isaac's face gets a permanent, very exaggerated expression resembling a horse.

Pills.Effect: Causes Isaac to grow four hairs from the top of his head and zits on his face. This pill is cosmetic only and will stay for the rest of the run. Consuming three puberty pills will grant the  Adult transformation, granting one red heart container and making Isaac's voice slightly deeper (one time effect).
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: Isaac gains very fluffy hair covering his entire head and even face.

Pills.Effect: Grants a fly orbital, up to 3 maximum, that circles the player, blocking projectiles and damaging fly-type enemies on touch.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: Spawns a Big Fan. There is no upper limit. These Big Fans do not contribute towards the  Beelzebub transformation.

Pills.Effect: -2.00 range.-1.00 range.
+2.50 range.+1.25 range.
-0.12 speed.
+0.15 speed.
-0.28 tears.
+0.35 tears.
-1 luck.
+1 luck.

Teleports Isaac to a random room. Has a small chance to teleport Isaac to the I AM ERROR room, and an extremely small chance to teleport him to the Black Market, like Undefined. Unobtainable in Greed Mode.  Using a Telepills in the mirrored version of Downpour/Dross II has a chance to teleport Isaac to an Ultra Secret Room.
Drops one to two  Lil' Batteries and fully charges the spacebar item.  Can be used with Placebo or D1 to generate infinite batteries.

Sets Isaac's red heart health to 1, then spawns 1-4  Red Hearts. This fills Isaac's first red heart container (even if Isaac's red health is less than 1) and empties the rest, including  Bone Hearts. This effect does not count as damage. If used without any red heart containers, no health will be deducted, but red hearts will still spawn. If used in aSuper Secret Room containing a Black Heart or  Eternal Heart, it will spawn those types of hearts instead.
Prevents Isaac from moving and shooting for 2 seconds.
Opens all entrances to the Secret Room and Super Secret Room for the current floor.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: In addition to the normal effect, fully reveals the map like The Mind.

Pills.Effect: Charms all enemies in the room for a short period of time.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: The charm is permanent, turning the enemies friendly.

Pills.Effect: Replaces the floor map with a? for the rest of the floor, identical to the effect of Curse of the Lost. If no other curses are active for the floor, the Curse of the Lost will appear under the level name when the map key is held. This effect can be negated by picking up Black Candle, but will not prevent future uses of the Amnesia pill from giving the Curse of the Lost effect.  Also the only pill to have its flavor text appear on a piece of paper as curses do.
Spawns a large yellow pool (similar to Lemon Mishap) around Isaac. Greatly damages any enemy that steps on it, for 22 damage per tick or 66 damage per second.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: The puddle is larger, covering nearly the entire room if used near the center.

Pills.Effect: Tears are shot diagonally outwards for 30 seconds, making it much harder to aim. This effect will persist between rooms until it wears off.

For the duration of the room, taking damage only removes a half-heart from Isaac's HP, regardless of the source of the damage. (Similar effect toThe Wafer's)Unlocked by:  Complete PAY TO PLAY (challenge #24).

For the duration of the room, taking damage removes a full heart from Isaac's HP, regardless of the source of the damage. Also changes Isaac's appearance for the room.Unlocked by:  Complete PAY TO PLAY (challenge #24).

Spawns  Poop at Isaac's position for a few seconds. A higher speed stat means Isaac can cover more tiles in poop in the same time. A pun on laxatives.Unlocked by:  Complete Have a Heart (challenge #25).

Gives the Curse of the Maze effect for the remainder of the floor. The effect can stack with other curses. If no other curses are active for the floor, Curse of the Maze will appear under the level name when Tab is held. This effect can be negated by picking up Black Candle, but will not prevent future uses of the??? pill from giving the Curse of the Maze effect. As the pill's name is ???, the same as what unidentified pills are referred to, it is easy to accidentally use it more than once per run. It is recommended to memorize its color upon first using it.Unlocked by:  Complete Have a Heart (challenge #25).

Increases Isaac's size and decreases the pitch of his voice. This effect does not increase the size of Isaac's hitbox, but increases the size of  The Forgotten's bone club.  These pills contribute to the Stompy transformation.
Decreases Isaac's size and increases the pitch of his voice. This effect decreases the size of Isaac's hitbox; a small enough hitbox allows Isaac to walk under certain projectiles to avoid them.
Destroys all poop in the room and spawns a single blue spider under Isaac and on each destroyed poop.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: Double the number of spiders spawned.

Pills.Effect: Spawns blue spiders equal to the number of enemies in the room. If there are no enemies in the room, spawns 1-3 Blue Spiders.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: Double the number of spiders spawned.

Pills.Effect: Temporarily grants invulnerability, inflicts fear on enemies in the room, lets Isaac deal contact damage, and has a chance to replenish a  Half Red Heart every time an enemy is killed, similar to The Gamekid.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: In addition to the normal effect, grants Huge Growth for +7 flat damage and +3 range. The Huge Growth bonus persists after the Gamekid wears off.

Pills.Effect: Applies a pixelating filter on the screen 3 times over 30 seconds. The effect continues between floors. Pixelates the screen and degrades colors for 30 seconds.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: The effect lasts 90 seconds, with no breaks.

Pills.Effect: Spawns three blue flies.
Creates a pool of slippery brown creep underneath Isaac.
Creates a pool of black creep beneath Isaac that slows enemies.

Slows all enemies for the duration of the room. Applies the Stop Watch effect, slowing all enemies, Isaac, and the background music as well as additionally applying the Slowness status effect on every enemy for the duration of the room.

Increases the speed of all enemies for the duration of the room. Increases the speed of all enemies, Isaac, and the background music for the duration of the room.The effect triggers again three additional times.
Destroys any trinkets held by Isaac and grants their effects permanently.Unlocked by:  Complete a Victory Lap by defeating The Lamb.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: Heals one red heart per gulped trinket (Up to 2 at the same time with Mom's Purse). No effect for characters who cannot have red hearts. This counts for two gulp pills toward the Marbles achievement.

Pills.Effect: Isaac shoots an explosive tear with the Ipecac effect that always deals 200 damage.Unlocked by:  Participate in 31 Daily Challenges (they don't have to be consecutive; it will still count if Isaac dies in the first room).
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: Isaac shoots a cluster of 6 Horf! tears with 150-400 damage per tear, resulting in an average of 1650 damage if all tears or their explosions hit.

Pills.Pill: Feels like I'm walking on sunshine!
Pills.Effect: Temporarily makes Isaac invincible, similar to Unicorn Stump.Unlocked by:  Collect every entry in the Bestiary (bugged v190 - Mobs that don't exist in the bestiary are being counted. This allows Sin Collector to be unlocked without a complete bestiary).
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: The effect is upgraded to The Gamekid's.

Pills.Effect: Spawns the last pill used. Will spawn itself if no other pills were taken beforehand, or if Vurp! was the last pill used.Unlocked by:  Obtain 50 items in a run (duplicate passive items/familiars count towards the total, e.g., multiple Breakfast).
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: If the last pill was a normal pill, it becomes a horse pill. No further difference on horse pills themselves.

Pills.Effect: -0.15 shot speed.
+0.15 shot speed.

Increases one attribute and decreases another randomly, with the same power as normal attribute up/down pills. Will not reduce any attributes if taken with Lucky Foot, PHD or Virgo. Will not increase any attribute if taken with False PHD. If a pill-improving item is combined with False PHD, the pill gives an attribute increase, a decrease and a damage up.
Pills.Horse Pill Effect: The two effects are doubled in power.

Extra_Consumables.Name: Dice Shard
Extra_Consumables.Description: Upon use, invokes the effects of The D6 and the D20 at the same time, re-rolling all item pedestals and pickups in the room.

Extra_Consumables.Name: Emergency Contact
Extra_Consumables.Description: When used, will cause two  Mom's Hands to come down and grab two random enemies, dealing damage and, if they have 40 or more HP, pinning them to the ground temporarily.

Extra_Consumables.Name: Cracked Key
Extra_Consumables.Description: Creates a room adjacent to a viable wall, like Red Key.
